intro: Bupleurum petiolulatum var. petiolulatum, commonly known as the slenderleaf bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, yellowish-white flowers appear in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The roots of this plant are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties.
